greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(w>=1,1<=n<=w) read by rows: the number of rooted weighted trees with n nodes and weight w.
comment: Weights are positive integer labels on the nodes. The weight of the tree is the sum of the weights of its nodes.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1275
F. Harary, G. Prins, The number of homeomorphically irreducible trees and other species, Acta Math. 101 (1959) 141-162, W(x,y) equation (9a)
example: The first column (for a single node n=1) is 1, because all the weight is on that node.
program: EulerMT(u)={my(n=#u, p=x*Ser(u), vars=variables(p)); Vec(exp( sum(i=1, n, substvec(p + O(x*x^(n\i)), vars, apply(v->v^i,vars))/i ))-1)}
seq(n)={my(v=[1]); for(i=2, n, v=concat([1], v + EulerMT(y*v))); v}
xref: Cf. A000081 (diagonal), A000107 (subdiagonal), A036249 (row sums), A303841 (not rooted).
results.author: _R. J. Mathar_, May 02 2018
